page.title: 08The Stones Public House
page.content: The Stones public house is named after Henry Stone who was Lord of the Manor of Skellingthorpe. He died in 1693. In his will he gave land to Christ Hospital London. On the land they built cottages, a school and an inn which now bears his name and the coat of arms of Christ hospital. For the last 16 years the landlady has been Mrs Joyce Vaughan. The building has undergone changes internally and two rooms have been made into one large smoke room. There is also a bar and a beer garden.
